topic.title: Botnet is closing in on all sides, Zeronet will be under attack soon.
topic.body:
0chan was OK for a little while but the whole thing is filled with illegal content now. What a shame. Tragedy of the commons.

At least Elon Musk is doing something about it.

1534470841_1Kh3qLdTH2QKewUb6cWZa2dMveMT5.body:
> [pwnedbymarcus](#comment_6_148qBJuGc35jMvGc2rePkDvYwgdGgCJxKt): You sound like a huge conspiracy theorist. "every PC and phone since 2011 has a built in HARDWARE backdoor"? Yeah sure, I very highly doubt that. You also claim that data gets deleted from your PC reguarly, without your knowledge/permission, false. The TOR network was built BY the US government, sure, but they don't control all the exit nodes. ZeroNet isn't fully ready to take over, it still has it's bugs and flaws.

It's true, and has been news for years now. Intel's Management Engine and AMD's Platform Secure Processor as both perfect hardware backdoors and we now know they've been remotely exploitable since they were put in to computers.

Get with the times grandpa.

1565358798_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body: In order to route information to your node it's necessary to have an 'address.' One way around this would be a protocol which sends everything to everybody all the time, and users would rely on somehow parsing this data stream to pick out messages intended for or interesting to them. But the amount of bandwidth would be enormous.

Incidentally Tumblr's unique visits per month have shrunk by nearly 40% since 2016; could it be that Automattic will use the purchase to persuade Tumblr's customers to migrate to one of its other brands?

They paid 1 billion for Tumblr and sold it for 3 million.

> [watteau](#comment_84_1AM6ZY48ErJLzU89E7wPVjxoqyWuFnk33o): Gold is at a six year high.

Gold and silver are going to invert soon. Less silver has been pulled out of the ground since people started liking shiny rocks and it's very rarely recovered from industrial uses, unlike gold which is almost always recycled.

The only reason that silver is cheap right now is because big banks are suppressing the price, as whistleblowers have recently claimed.

1565584272_1F8BHc6FztvWRy9cttVXLj22DSSvM.body: 4 just came back for me too.

> [bigbadbob](#comment_205_1CLhLYdMKjXtium9yjuRkSnFvPfdoUTXAj): Would be a sad day for humanity if 4chan ever did get axed.  I cannot see it happening.It would signify total censorship... In my opinion

Well it happened already, modern 4chan is completely fake and overridden with chat bots, glowniggers, and a host of angry fags all of whom have permission of the site’s owner (Google) to wreck it as much as possible. Zeronet has a much better future.

> [joalmo](#comment_6_15ZG53yDqMJyxRy3jfkC4NGeKapAC5CDrL): 4chan has never allowed vpn or tor posting, I'm not sure about 8chan

In the old days there wasn’t a constantly updated list of Tor exit nodes available, so you could refresh your circuit and sometimes get a clear one to post on. Same with VPN’s. These days IIRC the Tor project makes available a list of exit node IP addresses.

1565570944_1KUSKrffaR1sfLwxZUXUPshLpKhh5.body:
> [wejehteman2](#comment_8_1GYTFEyxLQK2TdsHvXUknoqfV3f8xdxR6P): If someone with a botnet with thousands or tens of thousands of IPs started connecting to everyone and not sharing any data thus making 95% of the peers you are connected to non functional and requesting data and throwing it out there by clogging the few remaining legitimate seeders ability to distribute files to real people... that would be a tough nut to crack.

It seems obvious that 8ch’s getting knocked offline and the migration of at least part of its user base to Zeronet has caused some parties to step up attacks and I hope weaknesses are exposed and dealt with. It would be nice to be able to use i2p as a back end as well as Tor.

> [toyata](#comment_92_17mM4YqSx7nMkYcePZB2GWcJBzkogWpqA1): Isnt there a drawback running Multiple Tor in the same network?

Is there?

1566248008_1KSUcqHRcq26pF5vJ2297jrNcAzkN.body: Must have some way to control which images are downloaded and seeded. More than one way ideally. It’s evident that just showing thumbnails is bad mojo. MOAB already banned 08chan as well as 0chan for this.

OK I found the right combination of settings, spoiler thumbnails and always spoiler seems to just give me an icon depicting the file type, and no thumbnail. I’m hoping this means that I’m not downloading the actual thumbnails or images too. Thanks and sorry for my confusion.
Trying to upload a large PDF to /pdfs/ (450 MB or so) and I have this Processing post... message that’s been up for a good while now.
After much whirring and chugging it finally uploaded my file. I guess it just takes a while with large files.

1566291581_11TbhWmLbceRuHERFahR7cdrTSBN4.body:
A classical education like Francis Bacon or our founding fathers had was basically the erection of a framework teaching a person how to learn, using the seven liberal arts and sciences. Once you had a basic knowledge of these, plus Latin, Greek, French, and German, you could use books and dictionaries to explore the various avenues of knowledge which interested you. The whole world was open to you.

Compare it with today’s world where history professors at places like Harvard, Yale, Oxford, and so on don’t even need to know Latin or Greek, let alone both.

1566448853_12XcKUGvjkDZ5ufLFESyYLYXgELag.body:
Crypto is too fragile to destroy fiat. You’re looking at this the wrong way. What is the point of fiat? It’s to decouple the money creation, lending, and yes even destruction process from resources with value.

To destroy fiat, institute gold and silver coin. It’s universal, durable, valuable, portable, works without the Internet, and doesn’t require exchanges or third parties.

> [0nullz](#comment_5_12XcKUGvjkDZ5ufLFESyYLYXgELagrHyxz): How fragile is speech? When you open source code you turn it into speech. Why do you think the first thing nations attack is free speech? Due to it's power.

Passing around complicated little mathematical messages which require a network consensus and a big block chain or whatever is too fragile.

A coin can be mailed or passed on without a word, or a record, or an ISP.

> [0nullz](#comment_6_12XcKUGvjkDZ5ufLFESyYLYXgELagrHyxz): little mathematical messages? you mean encryption? when nation state militaries abandon the use of it them then we can agree.

Blockchain based crypto is inherently fragile and we’re on the cusp of everything but OTP being obsolete with quantum computing. Perhaps we’re already there.

> [0nullz](#comment_7_12XcKUGvjkDZ5ufLFESyYLYXgELagrHyxz): without even understanding i

You’re quick to accuse but I bet I know more than most people. I’ve been programming the IBM Q machine for a year now.
I don’t personally mind if you invest in crypto. I’m just not doing it myself. If you got in early and mines some Btc that’s great, otherwise it’s a very risky investment.

1550241221_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body: Neither sender or receiver should have to connect to the Internet to send or receive crypto. This is the weakness of all current crypto currencies.

The clear net is just designed to suck marketing data from you. I do almost all my browsing over Tor now, basically I only do online banking and bill pay and shopping in the clear net any more. I don’t even do anything illegal, I just don’t want the weirdos running the tech industry to learn any more about me.

1566899547_1CHaf5xV3RY8BaoknhfQBNKAYycPw.body:
>grains
>legumes
Best be soaking those first, as per Weston Price.

> [holeyhouseofair](#comment_72_1CHaf5xV3RY8BaoknhfQBNKAYycPwjjc57): Phytic acid is reduced by sprouting, you can also mix in raw mushroom into your final food which contains phytase which apparently can help break it down.

It’s not necessary to sprout, I don’t have any links on me now but one short 20 or 30 minute soak and rinse reduces phytates by a lot, overnight soaking practically to nil. Interesting note with the mushrooms. However I’d be careful eating raw mushrooms, the commercial ones are grown on poop, and no raw mushroom can be digested so they often give severe intestinal distress.

> [cldude](#comment_7_1DV5mvcvwtjyRiQpuNuXv9hwdYj27C3oob): The manure used for commercial mushrooms is pasturized so is safe to eat raw.

It’s not safe to eat raw after it’s been watered and fermenting for weeks as the mushrooms develop.

1566020351_15rMfe5FVSWwMffJvTpBUq9dFiLQP.body: We should use US silver dimes, pre-1967. They are anonymous, have intrinsic value, and can be mailed easily.

> [theecollector](#comment_42_15rMfe5FVSWwMffJvTpBUq9dFiLQPNxkuU): Everyone is talking about using privacy coins... you know using privacy coins is not really necessary unless you plan on withdrawing your "illegal" crypto into fiat... If you just keep your crypto in crypto like we all should be doing anyways since the usd, euro, yen are all going to shit anyways then then any coin is ultimately a privacy as to they are just Letters n Numbers in a line of code. It has not information about you personally...

I don’t trust crypto or the internet service providers. Deep packet inspection is already in widespread use, do you think it’s not being used to figure out who uses crypto? It’s literally just another type of fiat, controlled by whoever mined a shit ton of it at the start of each coin’s boom cycle.

I’m sticking with precious metals.

Even from those who encourage it.  They might find the info useful and possibly get you a bigger telescreen if its valuable info.  But I doubt it would Improve the social credit score..  maybe even loose a point or two for being a snitch.  I guess it would depend on the info.

Oh on the contrary snitching is seen as good by the authorities. In both the USSR and Nazi Germany children were taught to snitch on adults, it was a way to integrate snitch culture with the young generation.

> [bigbadbob](#comment_588_1CLhLYdMKjXtium9yjuRkSnFvPfdoUTXAj): I can proudly say that zeronet is the closest thing to social media i have ever partaken in:) I was thinking about making a fake twitter account.  It getting ridiculous though.  There is an actual expectation within society to have a facebook.  I've managed to go without one to date, but im actually feeling the heat of not having one.  People just expect you to be online so they can snoop ya. Potential employers.  Literally fall off the face of the earth without one.

Social media's dead. Nobody uses it any more except for snapchat. I know a teacher and the kids have given up on social media nearly completely. Some still use TikTok but that fad is dying off quicker than it launched.

Https://news.yahoo.com/amphtml/amazons-ring-camera-raises-civil-211456191.html

In an attempt to move this thread forward in an on-topic direction, Amazon's Ring (Amazon complies with many thousands of law enforcement requests for ring and Alexa data each year) is now being declared to be racist in that it catches a ''disproportionate'' number of minorities engaged in property crime and that's racist because then people put videos of thieves and vandals on Facebook where people are exposed to possibly racially biased footage, or something.

How can we, as a progressive society, move forward with a possibly racist surveillance state apparatus? I propose teams of AI censors who edit out any racially identifying visual data from surveillance camera footage.

1567613355_1N2qEDMQmLEuDo7QwvPvHMRmS69LM.body:
I'm actually pretty impressed with the amount of rare music that people have put on Youtube and the authorities don't seem very eager to take most of it down. You can use youtube-dl to download audio files directly, even whole playlists. The files still have to be id3 tagged, no good way to automate that.

On the other hand I have more CDs than a person can count, closer to ten thousand than five, and if I like music enough to listen to it twice I usually start looking for a CD or vinyl of it which are both very very cheap used.

> [peerco](#comment_31_14mdo8Vynym8XLbab1YXoNhLndUGT3t1zi): it can be sure made automated [...]

I've looked into taking the video title with Python and sticking it in the tag but the problem is most videos aren't tagged properly according to my specific mode of autism so I'd have to redo them anyway.

> [peerco](#comment_30_14mdo8Vynym8XLbab1YXoNhLndUGT3t1zi): attenzione (italiano)YT DL -> YT USER (!!!anon dl via tor does it too!!! perfect tracking of anonymous tor users) [...]

If you have pop3 / imap on your phone hooked to gmail, Google knows your real ip address at all times anyway even on mobile.
